evaluation.Q1: Does the chart effectively display the relationship between Agriculture, Industry, and Services sectors for GDP composition across countries?

feedback.improvement: Add data points representing countries' GDP compositions for Agriculture, Industry, and Services sectors
Modify the chart to include three axes representing Agriculture, Industry, and Services sectors

evaluation.Q2: Are the United States and China visually distinguished from other countries in the scatter plot?

feedback.improvement: Add data points for the United States and China
Use larger markers or different colors to highlight the US and China data points

evaluation.Q3: Is there a clear and relevant title that accurately describes the chart's content and purpose?

feedback.improvement: Add a clear and relevant title describing the GDP composition comparison across countries

evaluation.Q4: Are all three axes (Agriculture, Industry, Services) clearly labeled and easy to understand?

feedback.improvement: Add labels for Agriculture, Industry, and Services axes
Modify the chart to include three axes instead of two

evaluation.Q5: Can viewers easily compare sector contributions across different countries using this visualization?

feedback.improvement: Add data points representing countries and their sector contributions
Modify the chart to a 3D scatter plot or use color coding to represent the third dimension

evaluation.Q6: Are GDP values for each country clearly annotated on the chart?

feedback.improvement: Add text annotations displaying GDP values for each country

evaluation.Q7: Does the chart include grid lines to improve readability of data points?

feedback.improvement: Keep the existing grid lines to aid in reading data point positions

evaluation.Q8: Is there a balanced distribution of data points that avoids overcrowding while maintaining clarity?

feedback.improvement: Add data points representing countries' GDP compositions
Ensure balanced distribution of data points to avoid overcrowding

evaluation.Q9: Does the color scheme effectively differentiate between sectors without causing visual confusion?

feedback.improvement: Implement a color scheme to differentiate between sectors
Choose colors that are visually distinct and do not cause confusion

evaluation.Q10: Is the font size appropriate and consistent across all text elements (labels, annotations, title)?

feedback.improvement: Add text elements including labels, annotations, and title
Ensure consistent and appropriate font size for all text elements

evaluation.Q11: Does the chart provide sufficient contextual information, such as the data year or source?

feedback.improvement: Include contextual information such as data year and source

evaluation.Q12: Is there a legend that clearly explains the meaning of different colors, shapes, or sizes used in the plot?

feedback.improvement: Create a legend explaining the meaning of colors, shapes, or sizes used

evaluation.Q13: Are the chosen colors distinguishable for individuals with color vision deficiencies?

feedback.improvement: Implement a color scheme that is distinguishable for individuals with color vision deficiencies

evaluation.Q14: Does the overall aesthetic of the chart appear professional and suitable for the intended audience of economists, policymakers, and analysts?

feedback.improvement: Redesign the chart to appear more professional and suitable for the intended audience
Include all necessary elements such as data points, labels, and title to create a complete and professional chart

evaluation.Q15: Is the data-to-ink ratio optimized, with minimal non-essential visual elements?

feedback.improvement: Maintain the current minimal design when adding necessary elements
Ensure that all added elements contribute to data representation without unnecessary visual clutter
